task_summary: The robot is instructed to pour from a cup into a mug using a structured sequence: perceiving the mug, positioning itself, pouring, and retreating to complete the task.

task_long_description.overview: This episode documents a robotic arm tasked with pouring a liquid or substance from a cup into a mug placed on a workbench. The robot must accurately detect and locate the mug, move above it, perform a controlled pour at a standard tilt angle and rate, and then retreat. The scene contains a Universal Robots UR arm, a cup as the source, and a mug as the target on a wooden table. Precise motion and error recovery are crucial, especially given possible occlusions or missing detections.
preconditions: Cup is grasped and filled (assumed from initial pose)
Mug is positioned on table in workspace
Robot in pre-pour pose above table
stepwise_plan: Verify mug is visible or detect via vision
Move the held cup above the mug, offsetting in z for clearance
Pour contents from the cup into the mug at 45 degree tilt and normal rate
Retreat arm by 0.1m to clear workspace
success_criteria: Contents from cup are poured into mug
failure_and_recovery: Pour fails: abort or retry if safe
Collision or spillage: stop and notify
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when pour is complete and robot has retreated from the mug area.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Check if the mug is visible for reliable goal referencing.
Invoke vision-based detection of the mug if not visually confirmed.
Position pour source above mug with vertical clearance.
Perform pour from cup into mug at 45Â° tilt and normal rate.
Move arm away safely after pouring.

failure_modes: Mug not found by vision system
Collision with mug during above-mug motion
recovery_strategy: If mug not detected: retry DetectObject
Abort pour upon excessive tilt or blockage
Stop arm and notify on spillage
assumptions: Cup is already grasped and filled prior to first frame (not shown in contact sheet)
Instruction does not specify pour amount or rate; defaults used
No explicit request for retry or timeout in instruction, using nominal values
If scene/frames and instruction conflict, frames are prioritized
Contact sheet does not show grasp or pick, pour assumed to start from above mug

test_scenarios: grasp_fail (out of scope for this contact sheet)
